channel.title: 2012 - Mayan Calendar Wrong
channel.description:
http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/news/3972981/Mayan-2012-end-of-world-prophecy-wrong.html
I never believed it, but the thought is always there. I'm just posting this for anyone interested (I read it in the newspaper today which provided better wording).
Even if you don't care to admit it, I bet this worried most of you (me too).
Relax. Lol in their faces.

item.title: 2012 - Mayan Calendar Wrong
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:36, topic:423824”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=526479.msg3835855#msg3835855 date=1322891366]

We won’t need to be renewed because we will simply remove ourself from the earth!
We are obviously the seeds of aliens that will one day regroup with our martian brothers on Mars where will live out our days as Sample ALH84001 miners!

These are the people that run the world, are you happy with yourselfs? I bet you are…

He’s right though, how could life just poof out of no where. If you’ve ever seen the show Ancient Aliens, you’ll realize it

Stop trying to figure out why we have life and just enjoy it.
[/quote]
This is what I enjoy about life though.[/quote]
:p, learning this stuff its pretty cool

Read full topic

item.title: 2012 - Mayan Calendar Wrong
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

We are building up supplies for a huge EMP. Stuff that doesn’t hurt us if it doesn’t happen or helps us a lot if it does. For example: wood to burn, canned goods, gasoline.

en.wikipedia.org

Web Bot

Web Bot is an internet bot computer program whose developers claim is able to predict future events by tracking keywords entered on the internet. It was developed in 1997, originally to predict stock market trends. The creator of the Web Bot Project, Clif High, along with his associate George Ure, keep the technology and algorithms largely secret and sell the predictions via the website. Internet bots monitor news articles, blogs, forums, and other forms of Internet chatter. Words in the lexico...


Kind of cool. Not sure exactly how credible that program is, but I found it interesting nevertheless.

Read full topic

item.title: 2012 - Mayan Calendar Wrong
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:28, topic:423824”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=526479.msg3835427#msg3835427 date=1322867522]

He says it merely predicts a Mayan god, Bolon Yokte, will return to Earth on that date.

I did a report on this for my english class, all that was previously stated was that it was when the mayan calendar. People assumed that because it was where the calendar ended before they vanished ment that it was the date of the end of the world, which obviously it wasn’t. I still believe there will be a day where the world will renew itself, it always happens and always will.

I don’t think anybody can predict a correct date (agreeing with you)
But i do think that the world will some day end in Armageddon (not the jesus battle stuff) it just means the earth will be in total anarchy and engulfed in flames, therefore killing everybody.

What i mean is something is going to happen to wipe out the human race and other living creatures on earth, like another ice age for example.
[/quote]I will be dying very soon if I don’t get some heat in this house 0_o[/quote]
Build your basement up, and eat meg first if you get hungry (family guy <3)

Read full topic

Do you watch The Sky at Night with Sir Patrick Moore, and Brian Cox’s “The Wonder’s of the Universe”? They are my favourite.[/quote]
no i dont :o, I remember in the Curiosity thing, Steven Hawking or whatever his name is, said that the universe is perfect, if it wasn’t perfect, life would cease to exist. So its weird wondering how everything much much bigger then us is perfect, when we aren’t

You sounded very smart, my friend.

Shweet lol, yeah im interested in all that stuff too, i watched the entire series of the Universe on netflix. Pretty interesting stuff
[/quote]

Watch this then, another “conspiracy” destroyed:

If you’re into this stuff I guarantee you’ll enjoy this.[/quote]
saw it before on t.v The room with the marbles and everything :D. It’s just weird thinking that your not the only living thing in the universe, and that in the entire universe how Earth is smaller then a grain of sand. It makes you wonder, if we can only travel to the moon, and that took time to get to, imagine how long it would take to get to pluto.
